full_translation:
**The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes**

**Text Title:** *The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes*
Author unknown, approximately dated to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. It describes the technique of "stepping the *gang* and the Dipper." One scroll.
Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongshen* Section, Methods Category.

**The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes**

**Diagram of the Seven Primes**
The Dao of traversing the Five Planets involves pacing to summon the descent of the Five Planets—Water, Wood, Fire, Earth, and Metal—thereby invoking divine clouds and feathered canopies to ascend the steps of the Great Mystery. The method of Master Guxi requires holding the breath to mount the *gang*, traversing back and forth fifteen times. Upon reaching each planet’s position, press the left hand to the heart and silently recite: *"The Five Planets array their radiance..."* Before ascending the *gang*, first visualize the essence of the Five Planets within the Five Viscera. After each pacing of the *gang*, perform the prescribed gestures. Practicing this for fourteen years, one may ascend in broad daylight upon a dragon’s flight. The essential Dao lies upon this silk scroll—such is its diagram.

The Perfected of the Supreme Dao paces the path of the Five Planets to induce their descent into the chamber. Holding the breath to mount the *gang*, one must first invoke the names of the Five Planetary Sovereign Ladies. Only after this may one cross the *gang* and tread upon the stars. This means that upon first mounting the *gang*, one pauses to call their names; once the invocation is complete, one then crosses the *gang* and treads upon the stars. If, upon reaching each planet, one repeats the invocation of the name and style of the planet’s sovereign, it is all the more excellent. If the practice becomes too arduous, one may simply follow the old method. In ancient times, Master Yusha, Beilizi, and the Elder of Changling all ascended to heaven by this method, never shirking its difficulties.

This is what is meant by "cultivating life." Merchants toil ceaselessly—how could they fear hardship? Their sole aim is profit. If seekers of the Dao were as single-minded as merchants, how could they fail to attain immortality? Yet most beginners claim devotion and diligence, only to grow lax afterward, like a cart on the verge of collapse whose every joint loosens, or an ox burdened with a heavy load struggling on a long journey. Such are the afflictions of the unaccomplished, and the amusement of the attained. All such matters are of this kind. If one’s heart is refined as an inner mirror, it will resonate with the divine, and spiritual beings may awaken one’s ignorance, bearing the chariot of the stars and light.

**Arrangement of the Five Planets Diagram**
It should always face south, with Venus positioned in the west and Jupiter in the east, following the prescribed order. The reason is that the Five Planets conceal and reveal themselves unpredictably, unlike the Northern Dipper, whose fixed form eternally determines its position in the five directions. Thus, one cannot follow the planets’ shifting locations.

The Perfected of Primordial Simplicity said: When stepping the Five Planets, before first mounting the stellar *gang* and after descending from it, one must first visualize the essence of the Five Planets within the Five Viscera. Upon completing the visualization, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva five times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"The Five Celestial Bodies array in splendor, illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star averts calamity; the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Radiant Deluder dispels misfortune; Venus repels warfare.
Saturn guards the four quarters; I attain favorable augury.
My name is inscribed on jade tablets, recorded in the Emperor’s chamber.
Riding the whirlwind and fanning the light, I soar through the Great Void,
Emerging and entering the unseen, roaming and feasting in the ten directions.
Five-colored clouds cover me; I summon spirits and command the winds,
Enlisting the myriad numina, ascending as an Immortal Duke."*
This is recited while facing the *gang* with a focused mind, during the moments of ascent and descent.

**The Five Planetary Sovereigns and Their Consorts**
- **Eastern Jupiter, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Chenglan, style: Qingning. His Lady: Baorong, style: Feiyun.
- **Southern Mars, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Weiting, style: Sanrong. His Lady: Huaping, style: Xuanluo.
- **Central Saturn, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Zanglu, style: Danyan. His Lady: Kongyao, style: Feixian.
- **Western Venus, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Liaoling, style: Zhenxun. His Lady: Souying, style: Lingen.
- **Northern Mercury, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Xianxuan, style: Jingyuan. His Lady: Xuanhua, style: Long’e.

Holding the breath to mount the *gang*, first invoke the names of the Five Planets and their Ladies. Only then cross the *gang* and tread upon the stars. Begin by lifting both feet onto Venus, then ascend from Venus to Saturn, from Saturn to Mars, from Mars to Jupiter, from Jupiter to Mercury, and from Mercury return to tread upon Venus. After three complete cycles, hold the breath again to mount the *gang*, following the old method of traversing back and forth fifteen times. Upon reaching each planet’s position, invoke the names of the Sovereign Lord and his Lady, press the left hand to the heart, and recite the incantation.

The text states: When performing the ritual, one should face north while holding the concealed script, for beginners of the true and wondrous Dao, unfamiliar with the subtleties of stellar positions and the Dipper’s directional shifts, must face north while holding the text to gradually grasp its meaning. Once the script’s intent is understood and the stars’ movements with the seasons are recognized, one should naturally follow the Dipper’s orientation, pacing and visualizing accordingly. Thus, there is no fixed direction, and one need not always face north. Facing north is solely for beginners. This principle may be extended by analogy—no further questions are needed.

The Three Eights and the Twenty-Four Spirits may be recited in sequence, or all three Eights may be visualized at once. Alternatively, one may visualize the Upper Radiance at dawn, the Middle Radiance at noon, and the Lower Radiance at midnight—this depends on the practitioner’s intention. If one retreats to a secluded cliff, free from worldly affairs, and inwardly focuses on the Spirit Gate while absorbing the morning qi of the true, one may visualize the Three Eights at dawn, then reinforce each of the three periods with an additional visualization—this is even more excellent. However, worldly affairs often hinder consistent practice, and irregularity diminishes its benefits. In ancient times, the Perfected Lord of Xicheng and the Supreme Immortal of Tongwu both followed this Dao.

From the *Baoxuan Yulu Baijian Qingjing* it is said: Those who do not visualize the Twenty-Four Spirits or know the names of the Three Eights Radiance cannot be counted among the people of Great Peace, nor can they become ministers to the Later Sage.

The Primordial Perfected One of Great Simplicity said: If one wishes to transform and divide the body, conceal oneself in the eight directions, hide the form and conceal the radiance, enter emptiness and create darkness, summon the myriad things, and pursue and capture all evils, one must constantly cultivate the refined contemplation of the *Kongchang* (Space-Constant). This practice should also be performed on the Eight Seasonal Nodes and the Six Ding Days. If these coincide with double days, the practice may be repeated. Alternatively, one may perform it after pacing the *gang* (cosmic steps)—this is also excellent. Such is the Dao of concealment and disappearance.

Above the *Kongchang* *gang*, there are twenty-five black dots:

1. The first dot is named *Jiuchang* (Nine-Constant), where one may reside to escape form.
2. The second dot is named *Yuchang* (Nurturing-Constant), where one may transform the body into the myriad grasses and trees.
3. The third dot is named *Maochang* (Mao-Constant), where one may transform the body into the myriad mountains and hills.
4. The fourth dot is named *Liuchang* (Flowing-Constant), where one may escape *qi* and transform *qi*.
5. The fifth dot is named *Xingchang* (Moving-Constant), where one may escape fire.
6. The sixth dot is named *Shangchang* (Upper-Constant), where one appears to others as if between heaven and earth.
7. The seventh dot is named *Tianchang* (Heaven-Constant), where one may escape fire.
8. The eighth dot is named *Xuanchang* (Mystery-Constant), where one may escape water.
9. The ninth dot is named *Sanchang* (Three-Constant), where one may escape weapons.
10. The tenth dot is named *Chenchang* (Chen-Constant), where one may escape death.
11. The eleventh dot is the central *Zhuchu* (Prayer-Point) of *Kongchang*, representing the heart.
12. The twelfth dot is named *Hechang* (River-Constant), where one may transform into water and fire.
13. The thirteenth dot is named *Yuanchang* (Origin-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into grasses and trees.
14. The fourteenth dot is named *Guchang* (Ancient-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into birds at will.
15. The fifteenth dot is named *Sichang* (Si-Constant), where one may transform the body into birds and beasts.
16. The sixteenth dot is named *Jiuchang* (Nine-Constant), where one may escape misfortune.
17. The seventeenth dot is named *Shichang* (World-Constant), where one may escape spirits.
18. The eighteenth dot is named *Mingchang* (Bright-Constant), where one may escape water and become earth.
19. The nineteenth dot is named *Yuchang* (Jade-Constant), where one may dwell and become a tiger.
20. The twentieth dot is named *Fachang* (Dharma-Constant), where one may transform the body into a thousand forms.
21. The twenty-first dot is named *Yinchang* (Yin-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into a dragon.
22. The twenty-second dot is named *Huangchang* (Yellow-Constant), where one may transform into a woman and divide the body into a hundred forms.
23. The twenty-third dot is named *Dingchang* (Stable-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into the myriad things at will.
24. The twenty-fourth dot is named *Feichang* (Flying-Constant), where one may escape the body as the six domestic animals, unseen by others.
25. The twenty-fifth dot is named *Liuchang* (Six-Constant), where one may escape ghosts that kill people.

The method of pacing the *Kongchang* *gang* begins at *Jiuchang*. Each time one reaches the eleventh central star, one should softly recite the prayer:
*"The Four Brightnesses of the Upper Origin, the radiance of sun and moon, flowing light resplendent, the twenty-five stars, pour liquid to congeal the hun-soul, spirit-water disperses form, washes away filth and purifies, penetrating the dark and obscure. Jade tablets and blue registers, tall and inscribed with names, stone mirrors and jade horses, revealing the forms of ghosts. Conceal the body in the numinous weft, ascend to pay homage to the Upper Clarity."*

Within the first star of the Dipper lies the Inner Consort of the *Taiqing* (Great Clarity) Center, the Transformer, Concealer, and Escapist, named *Kongchang Fayuan*, with the style *Xin Zhengpi*. She wears a yellow brocade cloak and a cinnabar-green flying skirt.

The second star is the Inner Concubine of Embryo Transformation and Form Protection, named *Kongchang Sanci*, with the style *Luo Zhuying*. She wears a blue brocade cloak and a green-feathered flying skirt.

The third true star is the Upper Origin Primordial Mother of the Six Escapes and Seven Concealments, named *Kongchang Lingyi*, with the style *Chong Shuangzhao*. She wears a blue brocade cloak and an embroidered feathered skirt.

The fourth star of the *Niu* (Handle) is the Inner Consort of Concealed Radiance and Hidden Light, named *Kongchang Qilie*, with the style *Heng Danpan*. She is draped in a purple brocade robe and wears a yellow-feathered skirt.

The fifth star of the *Gang* (Net) is the Great Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Body and Changer of Radiance, named *Kongchang Yushu*, with the style *Chou Qiulan*. She wears a vermilion brocade cloak and a purple-green flying skirt.

The sixth star of the *Ji* (Record) is the Middle Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Concealer of Traces and Disperser of Images, named *Kongchang Qijing*, with the style *Bao Dingling*. She wears a vermilion brocade cloak and a blue-embroidered flying skirt.

The seventh star of the *Guan* (Pass) is the Young Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Divider of Radiance into Myriad Forms, named *Kongchang Yumo*, with the style *Tian Fanshu*. She wears a cinnabar brocade cloak and a blue-feathered skirt.

The eighth star of the *Di* (Emperor) is the Left Consort of the High Sovereign of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Sun, Moon, Water, and Fire, named *Kongchang Shi Qizhu*, with the style *Luo Maohua*. She wears a purple brocade cloak and an embroidered feathered skirt.

The ninth star of the *Zun* (Honored) is the Right Consort of the High Sovereign of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Metal, Stone, Mountains, and Rivers, named *Kongchang Ai Shangtiao*, with the style *Ling Yu Xuan*. She wears a green brocade cloak and a kingfisher-feathered skirt.

All nine wear their hair in cloud-like topknots.

To ascend the *gang* while holding the breath, one must first call the names of the nine stellar Inner Consorts, then step upon the stars.

The *Tai Bai* (Venus) star lies horizontally, its rays scattering like the edges of a blade. One then exhales the *Three Separates* and *Two Golden Flowers*, causing the *Tu Fei* (Chart Boiling) to fill the *Zeng Yu* (Augmented Realm) and the *Liu Chang* (Flowing Field). The *Xuan Shi* (Mysterious Chamber) is the bright and dense *Tai Bai* star. It moves horizontally, its rays scattering like the edges of a blade, spreading across the nine heavens.

The Perfected One, visualizing this star with its seven rays, constantly exhales the three western rays and draws in the two southern rays. Thus, the golden radiance pierces the eyes, the chart becomes luminous and seething, penetrating the entire body. Once penetrated, one may enter the stellar deities’ *Zeng Yu* and *Liu Yang* palaces. Within these palaces lies the *Xuan Shi*, where one may wander in tranquility and be revered as a Perfected One. These are the names of the chambers within the *Tai Bai* star.

Regarding the practice of the *Tai Shang Yin Shu* (Supreme Perfected’s Concealment Writ), the scripture states: When performing the practice, one should face north while holding the *Yin Shu* (Concealment Writ). This is because beginners in the true and wondrous have not yet ventured into the subtle and distant, do not understand the orientation of stellar positions, nor recognize the Dipper’s directional alignment. Thus, they should face north while holding the writ, gradually seeking understanding. Once the meaning of the writ is grasped and the turning of the stars is recognized with the seasons, one may naturally follow the Dipper’s alignment and pace accordingly. In this way, there is no fixed direction, and one need not always face north. Facing north is merely for beginners.

Perhaps this can be understood by analogy, and no further questions are needed.

The Perfected One of the Supreme practices the pacing of the Five Stars’ Dao to summon the descent of the Five Stars into their chambers. While holding the breath to ascend the *gang*, one must first call the names of the Five Stellar Lords and Royal Consorts, then step over the *gang* and tread upon the stars.

To ascend the *gang*, one should pause immediately upon reaching it and call the names, then step over the *gang* and tread upon the stars. If, upon arriving at each star, one again focuses the mind and calls the name of that star’s position, it is even better. Should this prove too cumbersome for regular practice, one may proceed as before.

In ancient times, Master Yushai, Beili Zisheng, and the Elder of Changling all followed this method to ascend to heaven, undeterred by its complexity. This is akin to the way of managing life. Do merchants, in their eagerness for profit, shrink from peril or hardship? Their sole aim is wealth. If seekers of the Dao were as single-minded as merchants, what could prevent them from attaining immortality?

Yet beginners often claim devotion and diligence, only to grow lax and negligent thereafter—like a cart on the verge of collapse, its joints scattering, or an ox burdened with weight, its hooves faltering on a long journey. Such are the failings of late learners, the very ones whom the accomplished mock.

If one can inwardly refine the mind as a mirror, this will stir the numinous. Then, divine beings may awaken one’s obscurity and bear one aloft in the chariot of celestial radiance.

When arranging the diagram of the Five Stars, one should face south, with Venus positioned in the west and Jupiter in the east, proceeding accordingly. The reason for this is that the Five Stars conceal and reveal themselves unpredictably, shifting without constancy. Unlike the Northern Dipper, which maintains its fixed form and determines the positions of the five directions, one cannot follow the stars’ transient locations.

The Three Eights, combined with the Twenty-Four Spirits, may be recited in sequence. Alternatively, one may invoke all Three Eights at once, or store the Upper Radiance at dawn, the Middle Radiance at noon, and the Lower Radiance at midnight—this is left to the practitioner’s intention.

If one retreats to a secluded cliff, cutting off worldly affairs, and inwardly focuses on the Spirit Gate while gathering the morning’s true qi, then at dawn one may invoke all Three Eights at once, and in each of the three periods, further store one radiance—this would be even better. However, worldly matters often make such consistent practice difficult. Infrequent practice yields only meager benefits.

In ancient times, the Perfected Lord of Xicheng and the Supreme One of Tongwu both followed this Dao.

As the *Baoxuan Yulu Baijian Qingjing* states: "Those who do not store the Twenty-Four Spirits or know the names of the Three Eights cannot be counted among the people of Great Peace, nor can they serve as ministers to the Later Sage. When receiving the *Dadong Zhenjing*, one should also receive the methods of the Supreme Dao. One’s robes and headscarves must not be lent to others, nor should one share vessels, carriages, clothing, beds, or sleeping quarters. This is to block the paths of filth and impurity and guard against the intrusion of perverse winds."

This is easily practiced, yet deemed difficult—such is the way of those whose faith in the Dao is not sincere, who aspire to fly yet sink instead.

For those cultivating the Grotto Chamber and pacing the Seven Origins, upon first rising from sleep, when first venturing out, and after meals, one should softly recite the incantation:

*"Five August Ones, Five Penetrations,
Jade Script of the Grotto Chamber,
Return to the Hidden Dao,
Expand the Seven Dawns.
The Mysterious Father gives birth to the hun-soul,
Transforming the One into spirit.
The Mysterious Mother gives birth to the po-soul,
Transforming the Two into body.
The Duke’s Son gathers my sinews and bones,
White Prime governs my essence and qi.
Long life and enduring vision,
Ascend as an immortal to the Ten Heavens."*

This must be recited without letting the ears hear the sound. This is the Supreme One’s hidden incantation, used to dispel perverse qi and summon spirit, enabling transformation, division of form, concealment in the eight directions, vanishing of the body, hiding of radiance, entering emptiness, and traversing darkness. It allows one to summon the myriad things, hunt down all treacheries, and cultivate the refined contemplation of the Void and Constancy.

One should pace the Void and Constancy *gang* once every seven days, as one would pace the Seven Origins. This may be done at midnight, noon, or dawn, within a quiet chamber. It should also be practiced on the eight solar terms and the six Ding days. If these coincide with doubled days, one may perform it twice, or pace it again after completing the steps—this is also good. This is the essential Dao of concealment and vanishing.

Upon the Void and Constancy *gang* are twenty-five black dots:

1. The first dot is the earthly name *Nine Constancies*, where one may escape form. Its taboo name is *Yingyu*, and its style is *Tongjiao*.
2. The second dot is named *Yuchang*, where one may transform the body into the myriad grasses and trees. Its name is *Huantong*, and its style is *Youyuan*.
3. The third dot is named *Maochang*, where one may transform the body into the myriad mountains and hills. Its name is *Jinshang*, and its style is *Haoting*.
4. The fourth dot is named *Liuchang*, where one may escape qi and transform qi. Its name is *Guqing*, and its style is *Taoji*.
5. The fifth dot is named *Xingchang*, where one may escape fire. Its name is *Haozhao*, and its style is *Xuansheng*.
6. The sixth dot is named *Shangchang*, where people see one as ascending to heaven and descending to earth. Its name is *Huangguang*, and its style is *Yuanlang*.
7. The seventh dot is named *Tianchang*, where one may escape fire. Its name is *Liaotiao*, and its style is *Zhuodu*.
8. The eighth dot is named *Xuanchang*, where one may escape water. Its name is *Kongtiao*, and its style is *Xiaxuan*.
9. The ninth dot is named *Sanchang*, where one may escape weapons. Its name is *Tengmin*, and its style is *Yunbian*.
10. The tenth dot is named *Chenchang*, where one may escape death. Its name is *Neiyi*, and its style is *Yiwei*.
11. The eleventh dot is the central incantation point of the Void and Constancy, the heart. Its name is *Dangyang*, and its style is *Yuanyuan*.
12. The twelfth dot is named *Hechang*, where one may transform into water and fire. Its name is *Liujing*, and its style is *Qizhuan*.
13. The thirteenth dot is named *Yuanchang*, where one may dwell and transform into grasses and trees. Its name is *Nanzhi*, and its style is *Jingji*.
14. The fourteenth dot is named *Guchang*, where one may dwell and transform into birds at will. Its name is *Dongsheng*, and its style is *Weitong*.
15. The fifteenth dot is named *Jichang*, where one may transform the form into birds and beasts. Its name is *Lixing*, and its style is *Houhua*.
16. The sixteenth dot is named *Jiuchang*, where one may escape misfortune. Its name is *Qingbao*, and its style is *Shangyang*.
17. The seventeenth dot is named *Shichang*, where one may escape spirits. Its name is *Cangyuan*, and its style is *Changming*.
18. The eighteenth dot is named *Mingchang*, where one may escape water and become earth. Its name is *Biyuan*, and its style is *Dongsheng*.
19. The nineteenth dot is named *Yuchang*, where one may dwell and become a tiger. Its name is *Guiqing*, and its style is *Yuyang*.
20. The twentieth dot is named *Fachang*, where one may transform into a thousand bodies.

21. The twenty-first dot is named *Lǜhuà*, where one may transform into a dragon. Its name is *Míng’ài*, and its style is *Xuántōng*, with the courtesy name *Zǐyuán*.
22. The twenty-second dot is named *Huángcháng*, where one may transform into a woman and divide the form into a hundred. Its name is *Rìkōng*, and its style is *Dōngyí*.
23. The twenty-third dot is named *Dìngcháng*, where one may dwell and transform into all things at will. Its name is *Yǐnyáng*, and its style is *Fūguāng*.
24. The twenty-fourth dot is named *Fēicháng*, where one may escape the body as the six livestock while remaining unseen by others. Its name is *Shàngyuán*, and its style is *Cángguāng*.
25. The twenty-fifth dot is named *Liùcháng*, where one may escape from ghosts and those who would kill. Its name is *Zhōngbiàn*, and its style is *Fēntú*.

When pacing the Five Stars, before ascending the stellar *gāng* and after descending from it, first visualize the essence of the Five Stars within one’s five viscera. Upon completion, click the teeth five times, swallow saliva five times, and softly recite the invocation:
*"The Five Celestial Bodies array in splendor, illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star averts calamity; the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Radiant Star dispels misfortune; the Great White repels weapons.
The Quelling Star guards the four quarters; I attain favorable divination.
My name is inscribed on the Jade Tablet, recorded in the Celestial Chamber.
Riding the whirlwind and fanning the light, I soar through the Great Void,
Emerging and entering the unseen, roaming and feasting in the ten directions.
Five clouds cover me; I summon spirits and command the winds,
Enlisting the myriad numina, ascending as an immortal lord."*

Conclude by focusing the mind toward the *gāng* and reciting the invocation at the moment of ascent and descent. When holding the breath to ascend the *gāng*, first call the names of the Five Stars and their consorts, then step over the *gāng* and tread upon the stars. Begin by raising both feet onto the Great White Star, then proceed from the White to the Quelling Star, from the Quelling to the Fire Star, from the Fire to the Wood Star, from the Wood to the Water Star, and from the Water back to the Great White. Repeat this thrice, then hold the breath again to ascend the *gāng*, following the established path fifteen times. At each star, call the names of the August Lords and their consorts, press the left hand to the heart, and recite the invocation.

**First, the Great White Star:**
Yellow brocade mantle, vermilion and azure flying skirts.

**Second, the Origin Star:**
Azure brocade mantle, green feathered flying skirts.

**Third, the True Star:**
Azure brocade mantle, embroidered feathered ceremonial skirts.

**Fourth, the Tie Star:**
Purple brocade mantle, yellow flowered feathered skirts.

**Fifth, the Net Star:**
Crimson brocade mantle, purple and azure flying skirts.

**Sixth, the Record Star:**
Crimson brocade mantle, azure embroidered flying skirts.

**Seventh, the Barrier Star:**
Vermilion brocade mantle, azure flowered feathered skirts.

**Eighth, the Imperial Star:**
Purple brocade mantle, embroidered feathered flying skirts.

**Ninth, the Venerable Star:**
Green brocade mantle, kingfisher feathered ceremonial skirts.
All wear cloud-coiled topknots.

For the method of pacing the *Kōngcháng* Dao, begin at the ninth dot, *Jiǔcháng*. Each time you reach the eleventh dot, the Central Star, softly recite the invocation:
*"The Four Luminaries of the Upper Origin, the radiance of sun and moon,
Streaming light resplendent, the Twenty-Five Stars,
Infuse the elixir and congeal the soul, divine water disperses form.
Washing away defilement and refining purity, penetrating the dark and unseen,
Names inscribed on Jade Tablets and Azure Records, carved in the High Pavilion.
Stone mirrors and jade steeds reveal the forms of ghosts;
Concealing the body with sacred talismans, I ascend to pay homage in the Upper Clarity."*

**Eastern Year Star August Lord:** Chénglán Qīngníng
**Consort:** Bǎoróng Fēiyún

**Southern Radiant Star August Lord:** Wéitíng Sànróng
**Consort:** Huápíng Xuánluó

**Central Quelling Star August Lord:** Cánglù Dānyán
**Consort:** Kōngyáo Fēixián

**Western Great White Star August Lord:** Liáolíng Zhènxún
**Consort:** Biāoyīng Líng’ēn

**Northern Water Star August Lord:** Xiánxuān Jīngyuán
**Consort:** Xuánhuá Lóng’é

**The Flying Pacing of the *Kōngcháng* Chart**
**Essential Instructions for Cultivating the *Kōngcháng* Method**

Whenever one wishes to pace the *Kōngcháng*, fly the *gāng*, escape form, transform appearance, and ascend to the Jade Clarity, perform the practice seven times in a month. On the eight solar nodes and the six *Dīng* days, follow this method. On the appointed day, enter the chamber, burn incense on both sides, spread out the chart and mat, face south, click the teeth twenty-four times, close the eyes, and visualize the Five Stars shining brilliantly in the five directions. After a long while, see them descend and enter the five viscera: the Metal Star into the Lung Palace, the Earth Star into the Spleen Palace, the Fire Star into the Heart Palace, the Wood Star into the Liver Palace, and the Water Star into the Kidney Palace. The Five Stars radiate light, illuminating the five viscera, and the body feels warm. Then visualize the August Consorts of the Five Stars and the names and attire of the Twenty-Five *Kōngcháng* August Lords and Morning Lords, each in their respective directions. When all is complete, softly recite the invocation:
*"Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth, the primal qi of the Four Origins,
Mysterious essence flowing and shining, illuminating the Five Luminaries.
Within are the Five Stars, the numinous lords and consorts,
The Twenty-Five Dots, the *Kōngcháng* Celestial Worthies,
Transforming and dividing forms a thousandfold and myriadfold,
Descending into the five viscera, coalescing into Jade Immortals.
Refining my seven *pò*, nurturing my three *hún*,
I raise my form to ascend, flying into the Dipper’s Gate,
Roaming and playing in the Upper Capital, the Five Stars gathering in throngs.
Today, in this mysterious celebration, I request that all be as recited."*

Draw in the starlight and qi, swallowing twenty-five times, then rise to pace the *gāng*. Stand with feet together on the Great White Star, hold the breath for seven cycles, face west, and softly recite:
*"The Western Seven Gates, white qi flying in radiance,
Above is the Luminous Emperor, the August Lord of Lesser Yang,
Whose name is Liáolíng, clad in cloud-garments,
Resplendent essence flowing, shining in the Metal Palace,
Called the Fifth Dot, the ancestral *Kōngcháng*,
Seated on talismans and bearing standards, summoning yin and seizing yang,
Transforming water and fire, seventy-four directions,
Enabling my flying pace, concealing my form and entering the void,
Driving the white chariot, soaring through cloud-chambers,
Enduring through heaven and earth, eternally enjoying boundless years."*

Look up and swallow seven breaths. Stand with feet together on the Quelling Star, hold the breath for twelve cycles, face southwest, look up to the heavens, and softly recite:
*"The Central August Four Qi, overseeing the Eight Numinous Ones,
Jade Terrace and Purple Chamber, where divine dots give birth to transformations.
Within is the Origin Star, the Five Emperors’ hidden names,
Called Cángduì, pacifying the Yellow Court,
Clad in flying cloud sashes, crowned with flowered essence,
Holding talismans and wielding battle-axes, resplendent with falling fire bells,
Enabling my flying pace, revealing to me the divine names,
Descending into the Spleen Palace, pacifying spirit and settling essence,
Ascending to heaven and entering the clouds, concealing form and escaping shape,
Transforming the myriad things, roaming the Jade Clarity,
Attaining union with the August Lord, together preserving the Great Luminosity."*

Draw in the starlight and swallow twelve times to conclude. Stand with feet together upon the Sparkling Deluder Star, hold the breath for three cycles, and softly recite toward the south:

*"Three Gates radiate brilliance, cinnabar light flows with essence,
Mysterious qi surges and billows, shining resplendent in the southern darkness.
Above dwells the Crimson August One, luminous spirit of the Five Constants,
Whose hidden name is Wéinìng, clad in brocade of refined essence,
Head crowned with a treasure diadem, waist hung with jade and tinkling bells,
Moving in and out of the Vermilion Palace, guarding the Crimson-Walled Forbidden Chambers.
Preserve and record my life, inscribe my birth in the Southern Palace,
Enable my flying pace, transform my qi and conceal my form.
When the day is auspicious and the Dao is practiced, all under heaven grows solemn and clear.
My heart-spirit binds to the real, my Five Hun souls shine with luminous clarity,
Aligning with the Three Qi, merging with the radiance of the Fire Star."*

Draw in the starlight and swallow three times to conclude. Stand with feet together upon the Jupiter Star, hold the breath for nine cycles, and softly recite toward the east:

*"Eastern Nine Qi, Azure Heaven’s Jade Gate,
Within dwells the Azure Dawn, Lord of the Mystic Heights,
Flowing azure surges and billows—this is the Celestial Hun-soul,
Whose hidden name is Chénglán, exalted by heaven and earth,
Body robed in phoenix garments, striped with tiger-skirt patterns,
Transforming to five luminous points, shifting into nine dawns of radiance.
Head crowned with azure essence, a jade diadem spanning the heavens,
Golden talismans and feathered tablets, cascading bells in profusion,
Holding the Hidden Script, soaring with feathered script,
Gather and safeguard my life-record, preserve my bodily form.
The Liver Gate shines without, illuminating the divine court within,
Welcoming my ascent, to rise and attend the Imperial Dawn."*

Draw in the starlight and swallow nine times to conclude. Stand with feet together upon the Mercury Star, hold the breath for five cycles, and softly recite toward the north:

*"Five Qi of the Northern Mystery, Mystic Gate of luminous spirit,
Northern Dawn flows with radiance, the apex of jade essence.
Within dwells the Supreme August One, exalted name of the Five Emperors,
Whose hidden name is Xiánxuān, clad in robes of profound azure,
Head crowned with a jade diadem, waist girded with tinkling bells,
Golden seals and jade tablets, kingfisher pendants gleaming bright,
Wandering the resplendent dawn, gazing beside the Eight Darknesses.
Mysterious ford descends, entering my Kidney Court,
Preserve and record the Five Spirits, treasuring the viscera with fresh glory.
Within and without, replete and overflowing, transforming and shifting my luminous form,
Bones take flight and ascend, rising to the Jade Clarity."*

Draw in the starlight and swallow five times to conclude. The pacing of the Five Stars is complete.

Next ascend to the first Void Constant Ridge, joining feet and stepping onto the Nine Constants above. Invoke:
"Lord of Earth’s Nine Constants, transform my radiance into hidden darkness,
Conceal my steps for me, that my form may escape."

Next ascend to the Nurturing Constant. Invoke:
"Next ascend to the Spirit Lord, whose form knows no fixed attire,
Transform me, that my body may become grass and trees."

Next ascend to the Mao Constant. Invoke:
"Venerable Mao Constant, who can sink and rise,
Transform my radiance for me, that I may become hills and mounds."

Next ascend to the Flowing Constant. Invoke:
"August Lord of Flowing Constant, whose form knows no fixed body,
Draw in and exhale for me, that qi may rise as smoke."

Next ascend to the Moving Constant. Invoke:
"Great Lord of Moving Constant, whose might subdues ten thousand ghosts,
Transform my form, that smoke may rise as fire."

Return to the Metal Star, hold breath for seven cycles, knock teeth seven times. Invoke:
"Fly through the Great Void, transform radiance through the Five Constants,
Northward enter the Five Qi, southward subdue the Three Yangs.
Golden talismans command spirits, the Supreme Emperor lends support,
Six Wus escape Six Jis, safeguarding passage through the Cavern Realm.
Great White guards the lungs, metal stabilizes stomach and intestines,
Within replete, without overflowing, form and soul soar together,
A thousand transformations, ten thousand changes, all desires fulfilled,
Ascending without bound, to wander the Upper Capital with the Jade Emperor."

Draw in qi and swallow seven times to conclude.

From Metal, take twelve steps to ascend to the Earth Star, joining feet and stepping onto the Constant above. Invoke:
"Above Constant soars, transforming into countless millions,
Conceal my radiance for me, ascending into the Nine Heavens."

Next ascend to the Heavenly Constant. Invoke:
"Heavenly Constant flows with flame, smoke rises to form ramparts,
Conceal my form for me, bearing spirit into fire."

Next ascend to the Mysterious Constant. Invoke:
"Mysterious Constant of the Northern Darkness, whose body is water,
Lead me to rivers and seas, that I may witness my attainment of perfection."

Next ascend to the Three Constants. Invoke:
"Three Constants transform might, light subduing the Eight Courts,
Grant me immortality, dispelling calamity and repelling weapons."

Next ascend to the Chen Constant. Invoke:
"Chen Constant of myriad transformations, whose body knows no fixed form,
Grant me immortality, escaping death to embrace life."

Return to the Earth Star, hold breath for twelve cycles, knock teeth twelve times. Invoke:
"Primal Emperor and Five August Ones, Great Spirit of the Central August,
Transform qi into Seven Metals, subdue the Three Mornings,
Escape the body, divide the form, ascend to heaven and enter clouds,
Summon the Five Spirits in unison, guarding my Spleen Gate,
That my viscera may swiftly transform into immortality,
Soaring through the Mysterious Void, mastering water and fire across ten thousand origins,
Wherever intention desires, ascending without end,
To befriend the August Consort and join the ranks of perfected beings."

Draw in qi and swallow twelve times to conclude.

From Earth, take three steps to ascend to Fire, joining feet on the Void Constant. Invoke:
"Void Constant most numinous, assisting the perfected above,
Enter my Crimson Palace, governing the myriad immortals."

Next ascend to the River Constant. Invoke:
"River Constant conceals and hides, veiling the Dao in the Eight Darknesses,
Water and fire transform, that I may attain immortality."

Next ascend to the Primal Constant. Invoke:
"Primal Constant transforms, grass and trees conceal the body,
That my form and radiance may unite with the perfection of the Dao."

Next ascend to the Ancient Constant. Invoke:
"Ancient Constant of Heaven’s Pair, entering and exiting without interval,
That my body may grow feathers and wings, flying to ascend to heaven."

Next ascend to the Si Constant. Invoke:
"Si Constant of Southern Li, erecting the Nine Clouds’ canopy,
Transform my form, that I may instantly become birds and beasts."

Return to the Fire Star, hold breath for three cycles, knock teeth three times. Invoke:
"Flowing flame and cinnabar clouds, Three Gates and lightning courts,
Five Constants transform and penetrate, myriad changes dense and deep,
Command the Earth Emperor, might subduing Northern Essence,
Upper Prime safeguards and records, securing my long life.
Today I step through the void, riding emptiness to enter the stars,
Mars assists the heart, my Dao resplendently clear,
A thousand divisions, ten thousand unions, all intentions instantly fulfilled,
Soul guided, spirit refined, feathered robes timely born,
To join the Five August Ones, shouldering the Jade Clarity."

Draw in qi and swallow three times to conclude.

From Fire, take nine steps to ascend to Wood, joining feet and the Nine Constants. Invoke:
"Nine Constants of the Azure August, root of heaven and earth’s soul,
Grant me transformation, that my radiance may escape and hide in mountains."

Next ascend to the World Constant. Invoke:
"World Constant of Heaven’s numen, universally delivering the myriad immortals,
Grant me steps through the void, that form and radiance may unite as spirit."

Next ascend to the Illuminating Constant. Invoke:
"Illuminating Constant shines brightly, light illuminating the Eight Corners,
Grant me transformation of form, escaping water to become earth."

Next ascend to the Jade Constant. Invoke:
"Jade Constant’s mighty transformations, governing and commanding the Five Lands,
Grant me transformation of form, instantly standing as a tiger."

Next ascend to the Dharma Constant. Invoke:
"Dharma Constant governs wood, position uniting all immortals,
Grant me division of radiance, that my body may transform into thousands."

Return to the Wood Star, hold breath for nine cycles, knock teeth nine times. Invoke:
"Lesser Yang’s Nine Gates, wandering the azure heavens,
Within dwell the Five Constants, transforming into countless millions,
Summoning yin and calling yang, governing and commanding the Metal Spirit,
Eastern Florescence commands the tally, tally responding naturally,
Stepping through the void, treading emptiness, spurring the chariot of azure smoke,
Above descending the Azure Numen, below stabilizing the Liver Gate,
Dao clear in nine unions, instantly attaining flying immortality,
To join the Azure August, perfected in the Wood Dawn."

Draw in qi and swallow nine times to conclude.

From Wood, take five steps to ascend to Water, joining feet on the Yin Constant above. Invoke:
"Yin Constant of Northern Darkness, origin of myriad transformations,
Grant me abiding here, that I may instantly become a divine dragon."

Next ascend to the Yellow Constant. Invoke:
"Yellow Constant’s yin transformations, transforming into immortal youths,
Grant me division of form, that I may instantly become a hundred selves."

Next ascend to the Stabilizing Constant. Invoke:
"Stabilizing Constant governs the origin, transformations dense and flourishing,
Grant me division of form, that I may become the myriad things."

Next ascend to the Flying Constant. Invoke:
"Flying Constant governs the origin, entering the void above and below,
Voices resounding in a hundred tones, transforming into the six domestic animals,
That others may not see me."

Next ascend to the Six Constants. Invoke:
"Six Constants govern the net’s cords, commanding ghosts and spirits,
Revolving heaven and earth, slaying life when encountered."

Return to the Water Star, hold breath for five cycles, knock teeth five times. Invoke:

The Northern Mystery’s five qi open wide the five gates,
From their midst arises the Black Sovereign, styled the Five Constants.
Transforming through the hidden and dark, emerging from yin into yang,
They summon the Three Thunders, commanding the Earth Officials,
Enabling my flying steps to escape the sun’s shadow into the great void,
Wherever I turn, my form divides in a hundred directions.
Ascending to the Celestial Hook, I rise to Jade Capital,
My body sprouting wondrous fur, my kidney palace receiving fragrance.
Today I practice the Dao, the ancestral way of divine transcendents,
Attaining the celestial vow, enjoying boundless blessings.
Draw in qi and swallow five times to conclude.

When the steps of the Constant Capital are complete, descend through the gate,
Knock teeth thirty-six times, face the celestial stem and chant the *Three Caverns Flying Steps* chapter.
Take nine steps to ascend the Yang Brightness Star, join feet and face east, invoking:
"Concealing Transformation, Hidden Escape, Inner Consort of the Supreme Palace,
Great Divinity Supreme Unity, Supreme Venerable One,
Who oversees the registers of destiny,
Grant me immortal attainment, conceal my form, escape my self,
Ascend to the imperial chariot."

Next ascend the Yin Essence, face northeast and invoke:
"Inner Concubine of Embryo-Protection and Form-Transformation in the Middle Prime Palace,
Supreme Perfected, Lofty Mystery-Spirit,
Who severs the placenta, unties knots, refines the embryo, and secures essence,
Transforming in myriad ways,
Grant me long life."

Next ascend the Adjuvant Star, face the Perfected and invoke:
"Primal Mother of the Six Escapes and Seven Concealments in the True Prime Palace,
Who nurtures my embryonic birth, conceals me in the golden chamber,
Transforms my ascent to the azure carriage,
Grant me flight through the void, boundless years."

Next ascend the Mysterious Darkness, face north and invoke:
"Inner Consort of Concealed Radiance and Hidden Light in the Cord of Darkness Palace,
Great Ancestral Spirit of Divine Transcendents, Numinous Might,
Who ferries me across the Six Wus, liberates me from the eight directions,
Enables my escape through flying steps,
Ascending beyond the imperial chambers."

Next ascend the Cinnabar Prime, face west and invoke:
"Great Maiden of the Dipper in the Webbed Spirit Palace of Body-Transformation and Light-Shifting,
Mysterious transformation without form,
Who ferries me across the Primal Dipper,
Inscribes my name beside the Emperor,
Enables flight through the void, riding the empty,
My body soaring, casting no shadow."

Next ascend the Northern Culmen, face northeast and invoke:
"Middle Maiden of the Dipper in the Hidden Boundary Palace of Scattered Multitudes,
Numinous transformation of the Supreme Palace,
Who removes my name from the mysterious register,
Transfers my destiny across all directions,
Divides my form into thousands,
Reverses my appearance to regain youth."

Next ascend the Celestial Gate, face northwest and invoke:
"Maiden of the Dipper in the Palace of Convergence and Meeting,
Where forms divide into myriad shapes,
Supreme Mystery-Spirit,
Who follows the Dipper’s mechanism, revolving the myriad lives,
Grant me flight through the void,
Transformation into the great darkness."

Next ascend the Adjuvant Star, face the Heavenly Gate, knock teeth nine times, and invoke:
"Left August Consort of the Imperial Seat Palace,
Who faces the Imperial Lord,
Aligns her radiance with the Perfected,
Styled the Void Constant,
Transforming across the nine heavens,
Conducting the sun and moon,
Gathering qi into mist,
Revolving water and fire,
Banishing the ten thousand anomalies from my body.
At this moment, the primal auspice unfolds,
Mysterious blessings spread forth,
Grant me flying steps,
Riding the Constant into the Perfected,
Nine dawns flowing and falling,
Enjoying ten thousand blessings,
My form equaling celestial radiance,
My lifespan matching the numinous pillar."

Raise the head and swallow twenty-four times to conclude.

Next ascend the Adjuvant Star, face the Earth Gate, knock teeth nine times, and invoke:
"Right August Consort of the Supreme Palace,
Supreme Venerable Empress,
Who unites with the numinous in the Flowery Chamber,
Heavenly soul and earthly spirit,
Styled the Supreme Void,
Transforming the nine qi,
Ancestral progenitor of the myriad Perfected,
Revolving metal and turning stone,
Achieving merit equal to heaven,
Dissolving mountains and drying rivers,
Summoning clouds and calling dragons,
The ten thousand anomalies responding instantly,
Dividing my radiance into a hundred million transformations,
Flying steps treading the void,
Flowing brilliance to the four directions,
Concealing my body in the Dipper’s seat,
My robe covering celestial radiance,
Abiding long between heaven and earth,
Enjoying boundless blessings.
May my wishes be fulfilled,
Receiving blessings forever."

The *Supreme Five Stars, Seven Primes, Void Constant Formula* concludes.

1. The phrase *"Xin zheng pi"* (辛正披) appears in the *Shangqing Wuchang Wanhua Yuming Jing* as *"Xin zheng fu"* (辛正扶).
2. Based on the explanation below, this line should read: *"Tu ming fei zeng yu liu yang"* (图明沸增宇流扬).
3. The content and wording of this section largely overlap with the preceding *"Seven Primes Diagram"* and may be cross-referenced.
4. *"Bu bi"* (步毕) appears in the *"Seven Primes Diagram"* as *"bu gang"* (步罡).
5. The characters *"bing zu"* (并足) are supplied here based on contextual coherence.

chunks.original_text: 太上五星七元空常诀 经名：太上五星七元空常诀。 撰人不详，约出於南北期。 内言飞步罡斗术。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞神部方法类。 太上五星七元空常诀 七元图 飞行五星之道，以寻步水木火土金五星来降，致神云羽盖，登太玄之阶。 谷希子法，闭气上罡，往还十五过。 每至星所，左手拊心，默祝曰：五星列照云云。 未登罡时，先存五星精在五藏中也。 每步罡毕，辄按而为之。 行之十四年，白日龙飞，要道在尺素上，是此之图矣。 太上真人步五星之道，以致五星降室，闭气上罡，当先呼五星皇夫人名字，毕乃越罡蹈星。 谓始上罡便顿住呼名字，呼名字毕，乃越罡蹈星耳。 若每至星上，得复重心呼所至星处之名伊字，益其佳也。 若其须重难常，但可按旧'而行耳。 昔郁沙公、北里子生、长陵'老人，皆按此法而得升天，不以烦难为辞也。 所谓治生者矣。 商贩汲汲，岂惮脸难哉，所期唯钱货而已耳。 若使求道者，常如贾贩之用心，亦有何不得仙耶。 但惜初学者皆言专尽勤至，而后辄懈纵，有似车之将败而百节缓落，又似负重之牛造远足蹇。 末学者之所患，而为得者之所笑，皆如此辈事耳。 苟心研内镜者，是为感发乎神，将有灵人发子之蒙，担辰景之舆矣。 五星布图，常向南也，以太白位在西，岁星在东，按而施之。 所以尔者，五星隐伏，纵横无常。 不如北斗列象，恒在故一，以定位於五方，不得随星之所在也。 太素真人曰：步五星，初未登星罡之时，及讫下罡之时，并先存五星之精在我五藏中，存毕，叩齿五通，咽液五过，微祝曰： 五辰列横，焕朗五方，水星却灾，木星致昌，荧惑消祸，太白辟兵，镇星四据，我得利贞，名刊玉简，录字帝房，乘飕扇景，飞腾太空，出入冥无，游宴十方，五云覆盖，招神摄风，役使万灵，上为仙公。 毕。 正心向罡口，当上下之际而存祝之也。 东方岁星真皇君，名澄澜，字清凝。 夫人名宝容，字飞云。 南方荧惑真皇君，名维停，字散融。 夫人名华瓶，字玄罗。 中央镇星真皇君，名藏陆，字耽延。 夫人名空瑶，字飞贤。 西方太白真皇君，名寥凌，字振寻。 夫人名飕英，字灵恩。 北方辰星真皇君，名咸晅，字精源。 夫人名玄华，字龙娥。 闭气上罡，当先呼五星名字，及夫人名字。 毕乃越罡蹈星。 先举两足上太白，从太白登镇星，从镇登火星，从火登木星，从木登辰星，从辰星还蹑太白。 凡三过，乃更闭气上歪，按旧往还十五过。 每至星所，辄呼皇君及夫人名字，左手村心，祝曰云云。 经曰：行事时，皆北向执隐书而为之者，谓始学真妙，未涉微远，不解星位之首向，不识玄斗之指建，故当北向执书，以渐求之耳。 若既解书意，识星转之随时，自宜随斗所指，按而存步，如此则无有常向，不为皆向北也。 夫一切北向，自为始学者耳。 恐此将可以意通触类，不足复问耶。 三八景合二十四神，以次念之，亦可一时顿存三八，亦可平旦存上景，日中存中景，夜半存下景，在人意为之也。 若外身幽岩，屏绝人事，内念神阙，摄真朝气，将可平旦顿存三八景，三时又各重存一景，益当佳也。 但人间多事，此烦难常行耳。 事不得常，为益自薄。 昔西城王君、桐梧上真，皆按此道也。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes**

**Text Title:** *The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes*
Author unknown, approximately dated to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. It describes the technique of "stepping the *gang* and the Dipper." One scroll.
Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongshen* Section, Methods Category.

**The Supreme Perpetual Secret of the Five Planets and Seven Primes**

**Diagram of the Seven Primes**
The Dao of traversing the Five Planets involves pacing to summon the descent of the Five Planets—Water, Wood, Fire, Earth, and Metal—thereby invoking divine clouds and feathered canopies to ascend the steps of the Great Mystery. The method of Master Guxi requires holding the breath to mount the *gang*, traversing back and forth fifteen times. Upon reaching each planet’s position, press the left hand to the heart and silently recite: *"The Five Planets array their radiance..."* Before ascending the *gang*, first visualize the essence of the Five Planets within the Five Viscera. After each pacing of the *gang*, perform the prescribed gestures. Practicing this for fourteen years, one may ascend in broad daylight upon a dragon’s flight. The essential Dao lies upon this silk scroll—such is its diagram.

The Perfected of the Supreme Dao paces the path of the Five Planets to induce their descent into the chamber. Holding the breath to mount the *gang*, one must first invoke the names of the Five Planetary Sovereign Ladies. Only after this may one cross the *gang* and tread upon the stars. This means that upon first mounting the *gang*, one pauses to call their names; once the invocation is complete, one then crosses the *gang* and treads upon the stars. If, upon reaching each planet, one repeats the invocation of the name and style of the planet’s sovereign, it is all the more excellent. If the practice becomes too arduous, one may simply follow the old method. In ancient times, Master Yusha, Beilizi, and the Elder of Changling all ascended to heaven by this method, never shirking its difficulties.

This is what is meant by "cultivating life." Merchants toil ceaselessly—how could they fear hardship? Their sole aim is profit. If seekers of the Dao were as single-minded as merchants, how could they fail to attain immortality? Yet most beginners claim devotion and diligence, only to grow lax afterward, like a cart on the verge of collapse whose every joint loosens, or an ox burdened with a heavy load struggling on a long journey. Such are the afflictions of the unaccomplished, and the amusement of the attained. All such matters are of this kind. If one’s heart is refined as an inner mirror, it will resonate with the divine, and spiritual beings may awaken one’s ignorance, bearing the chariot of the stars and light.

**Arrangement of the Five Planets Diagram**
It should always face south, with Venus positioned in the west and Jupiter in the east, following the prescribed order. The reason is that the Five Planets conceal and reveal themselves unpredictably, unlike the Northern Dipper, whose fixed form eternally determines its position in the five directions. Thus, one cannot follow the planets’ shifting locations.

The Perfected of Primordial Simplicity said: When stepping the Five Planets, before first mounting the stellar *gang* and after descending from it, one must first visualize the essence of the Five Planets within the Five Viscera. Upon completing the visualization, knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva five times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"The Five Celestial Bodies array in splendor, illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star averts calamity; the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Radiant Deluder dispels misfortune; Venus repels warfare.
Saturn guards the four quarters; I attain favorable augury.
My name is inscribed on jade tablets, recorded in the Emperor’s chamber.
Riding the whirlwind and fanning the light, I soar through the Great Void,
Emerging and entering the unseen, roaming and feasting in the ten directions.
Five-colored clouds cover me; I summon spirits and command the winds,
Enlisting the myriad numina, ascending as an Immortal Duke."*
This is recited while facing the *gang* with a focused mind, during the moments of ascent and descent.

**The Five Planetary Sovereigns and Their Consorts**
- **Eastern Jupiter, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Chenglan, style: Qingning. His Lady: Baorong, style: Feiyun.
- **Southern Mars, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Weiting, style: Sanrong. His Lady: Huaping, style: Xuanluo.
- **Central Saturn, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Zanglu, style: Danyan. His Lady: Kongyao, style: Feixian.
- **Western Venus, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Liaoling, style: Zhenxun. His Lady: Souying, style: Lingen.
- **Northern Mercury, True Sovereign Lord:** Name: Xianxuan, style: Jingyuan. His Lady: Xuanhua, style: Long’e.

Holding the breath to mount the *gang*, first invoke the names of the Five Planets and their Ladies. Only then cross the *gang* and tread upon the stars. Begin by lifting both feet onto Venus, then ascend from Venus to Saturn, from Saturn to Mars, from Mars to Jupiter, from Jupiter to Mercury, and from Mercury return to tread upon Venus. After three complete cycles, hold the breath again to mount the *gang*, following the old method of traversing back and forth fifteen times. Upon reaching each planet’s position, invoke the names of the Sovereign Lord and his Lady, press the left hand to the heart, and recite the incantation.

The text states: When performing the ritual, one should face north while holding the concealed script, for beginners of the true and wondrous Dao, unfamiliar with the subtleties of stellar positions and the Dipper’s directional shifts, must face north while holding the text to gradually grasp its meaning. Once the script’s intent is understood and the stars’ movements with the seasons are recognized, one should naturally follow the Dipper’s orientation, pacing and visualizing accordingly. Thus, there is no fixed direction, and one need not always face north. Facing north is solely for beginners. This principle may be extended by analogy—no further questions are needed.

The Three Eights and the Twenty-Four Spirits may be recited in sequence, or all three Eights may be visualized at once. Alternatively, one may visualize the Upper Radiance at dawn, the Middle Radiance at noon, and the Lower Radiance at midnight—this depends on the practitioner’s intention. If one retreats to a secluded cliff, free from worldly affairs, and inwardly focuses on the Spirit Gate while absorbing the morning qi of the true, one may visualize the Three Eights at dawn, then reinforce each of the three periods with an additional visualization—this is even more excellent. However, worldly affairs often hinder consistent practice, and irregularity diminishes its benefits. In ancient times, the Perfected Lord of Xicheng and the Supreme Immortal of Tongwu both followed this Dao.

chunks.original_text: 按《苞玄玉录白简青经》云：不存二十四神，不知三八景名字者，不得为太平民，亦不得为后圣之臣。 太素真人曰：欲变化分形，隐沦八方，匿躯藏景，入空造冥，来致万物，讨捕众奸，当恒修空常之精思也。 八节日、六丁日亦修之。 若并重日者，亦再行之，或以步罡后仍行，亦善。 此隐沦之道也。 其空常罡上，有二十五黑点： 第一点地名九常，居之以逃形。 第二点名育常，化身为草木万物。 第三点名卯常，变身为山陵万物。 第四点名流常，逃气化气。 第五点名行常，逃火。 第六点名上常，人见之云上天下地。 第七点名天常，逃火。 第八点名玄常，逃水。 第九点名三常，逃兵。 第十点名辰常，逃死。 第十一点中祝处空常，心也。 第十二点名河常，化作水火。 第十三点名元常，住此化作草木。 第十四点名古常，住此化作乌随心。 第十五点名巳常，化形为乌兽。 第十六点名九常，逃凶。 第十七点名世常，逃神。 第十八点名明常，逃水成地。 第十九点名玉常，住此作虎。 第二十点名法常，化身为千。 第二十一点名阴常，住此化作龙。 第二十二点名黄常，化为女子，分形为百。 第二十三点名定常，住此化作万物任心。 第二十四点名飞常，逃身为六畜而人不见。 第二十五点名六常，逃鬼杀人。 步空常之道，始於九常，每造第十一中央星之所，而微祝曰： 四明上元，日月气明，流光焕曜，二十五星，灌液凝魂，神水散形，荡秽清练，洞彻幽冥，玉简青箓，高合刻名，石镜玉马，昭知鬼形，藏身灵纬，上朝上清。 斗第一太清中，有变隐逃元内妃，名空常法垣，字辛正披#1，黄锦帔，丹青飞裙。 第二元星保胎化形内嫔，名空常三瓷，字罗朱婴，青锦帔，绿羽飞裙。 第三真星六遁七隐上元元母，名空常灵夷，字冲双兆，青锦帔，绣羽华裙。 第四纽星匿景藏光中元内妃，名空常七列，字横单盘，紫锦被，黄华羽裙。 第五纲星变体易景斗中大女，名空常郁书，字畴丘兰，朱锦帔，紫青飞裙。 第六纪星隐逶散象斗中中女，名空常气精，字抱定陵，朱锦帔，青绣飞裙。 第七关星分景万形斗中少女，名空常郁墨，字天凡淑，丹锦帔，青华羽裙。 第八帝星化日月水火斗中高皇左夫人，名空常石启珠，字落茂华，紫锦帔，绣羽飞裙。 第九尊星化金石山河斗中高皇右夫人，名空常爱上条，字灵育玄，绿锦帔，翠羽华裙。 九人头并颓云髻。 闭气上罡，先呼九星内妃名字，毕乃蹑星也。 太白横悬散芒锋，遂吐三别两金英，图沸增宇流场#2，玄室皓郁太白星也。 横行而悬，散於芒锷，纵布於九天者也。 真人以此星有七芒，常存吐西方三芒，引南方两芒，於是金华彻目，图明沸骇，以洞一身，既洞，得与星神入增宇及流扬之宫，宫内有玄室，既晏而游，拜为真人也。 此皆太白星中宫室名也。 行太上隐书事#3 经曰：行事时，皆北向执隐书而为之者，谓始学真妙，未涉微远，不解星位之首向，不识玄斗之指建，故当北向执书，以渐求之耳。 若既解书意，识星转随时，自宜随斗所指，按而存步。 如此则无有常向，不为皆向北也。 夫一切北向，自为始学者耳。 恐此将可以意通触类，不足复问耶。 太上真人步五星之道，以致五星降室，闭气上罡，当先呼五星君皇夫人名字，毕乃越罡蹈星。
chunks.translated_text:
From the *Baoxuan Yulu Baijian Qingjing* it is said: Those who do not visualize the Twenty-Four Spirits or know the names of the Three Eights Radiance cannot be counted among the people of Great Peace, nor can they become ministers to the Later Sage.

The Primordial Perfected One of Great Simplicity said: If one wishes to transform and divide the body, conceal oneself in the eight directions, hide the form and conceal the radiance, enter emptiness and create darkness, summon the myriad things, and pursue and capture all evils, one must constantly cultivate the refined contemplation of the *Kongchang* (Space-Constant). This practice should also be performed on the Eight Seasonal Nodes and the Six Ding Days. If these coincide with double days, the practice may be repeated. Alternatively, one may perform it after pacing the *gang* (cosmic steps)—this is also excellent. Such is the Dao of concealment and disappearance.

Above the *Kongchang* *gang*, there are twenty-five black dots:

1. The first dot is named *Jiuchang* (Nine-Constant), where one may reside to escape form.
2. The second dot is named *Yuchang* (Nurturing-Constant), where one may transform the body into the myriad grasses and trees.
3. The third dot is named *Maochang* (Mao-Constant), where one may transform the body into the myriad mountains and hills.
4. The fourth dot is named *Liuchang* (Flowing-Constant), where one may escape *qi* and transform *qi*.
5. The fifth dot is named *Xingchang* (Moving-Constant), where one may escape fire.
6. The sixth dot is named *Shangchang* (Upper-Constant), where one appears to others as if between heaven and earth.
7. The seventh dot is named *Tianchang* (Heaven-Constant), where one may escape fire.
8. The eighth dot is named *Xuanchang* (Mystery-Constant), where one may escape water.
9. The ninth dot is named *Sanchang* (Three-Constant), where one may escape weapons.
10. The tenth dot is named *Chenchang* (Chen-Constant), where one may escape death.
11. The eleventh dot is the central *Zhuchu* (Prayer-Point) of *Kongchang*, representing the heart.
12. The twelfth dot is named *Hechang* (River-Constant), where one may transform into water and fire.
13. The thirteenth dot is named *Yuanchang* (Origin-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into grasses and trees.
14. The fourteenth dot is named *Guchang* (Ancient-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into birds at will.
15. The fifteenth dot is named *Sichang* (Si-Constant), where one may transform the body into birds and beasts.
16. The sixteenth dot is named *Jiuchang* (Nine-Constant), where one may escape misfortune.
17. The seventeenth dot is named *Shichang* (World-Constant), where one may escape spirits.
18. The eighteenth dot is named *Mingchang* (Bright-Constant), where one may escape water and become earth.
19. The nineteenth dot is named *Yuchang* (Jade-Constant), where one may dwell and become a tiger.
20. The twentieth dot is named *Fachang* (Dharma-Constant), where one may transform the body into a thousand forms.
21. The twenty-first dot is named *Yinchang* (Yin-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into a dragon.
22. The twenty-second dot is named *Huangchang* (Yellow-Constant), where one may transform into a woman and divide the body into a hundred forms.
23. The twenty-third dot is named *Dingchang* (Stable-Constant), where one may dwell and transform into the myriad things at will.
24. The twenty-fourth dot is named *Feichang* (Flying-Constant), where one may escape the body as the six domestic animals, unseen by others.
25. The twenty-fifth dot is named *Liuchang* (Six-Constant), where one may escape ghosts that kill people.

The method of pacing the *Kongchang* *gang* begins at *Jiuchang*. Each time one reaches the eleventh central star, one should softly recite the prayer:
*"The Four Brightnesses of the Upper Origin, the radiance of sun and moon, flowing light resplendent, the twenty-five stars, pour liquid to congeal the hun-soul, spirit-water disperses form, washes away filth and purifies, penetrating the dark and obscure. Jade tablets and blue registers, tall and inscribed with names, stone mirrors and jade horses, revealing the forms of ghosts. Conceal the body in the numinous weft, ascend to pay homage to the Upper Clarity."*

Within the first star of the Dipper lies the Inner Consort of the *Taiqing* (Great Clarity) Center, the Transformer, Concealer, and Escapist, named *Kongchang Fayuan*, with the style *Xin Zhengpi*. She wears a yellow brocade cloak and a cinnabar-green flying skirt.

The second star is the Inner Concubine of Embryo Transformation and Form Protection, named *Kongchang Sanci*, with the style *Luo Zhuying*. She wears a blue brocade cloak and a green-feathered flying skirt.

The third true star is the Upper Origin Primordial Mother of the Six Escapes and Seven Concealments, named *Kongchang Lingyi*, with the style *Chong Shuangzhao*. She wears a blue brocade cloak and an embroidered feathered skirt.

The fourth star of the *Niu* (Handle) is the Inner Consort of Concealed Radiance and Hidden Light, named *Kongchang Qilie*, with the style *Heng Danpan*. She is draped in a purple brocade robe and wears a yellow-feathered skirt.

The fifth star of the *Gang* (Net) is the Great Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Body and Changer of Radiance, named *Kongchang Yushu*, with the style *Chou Qiulan*. She wears a vermilion brocade cloak and a purple-green flying skirt.

The sixth star of the *Ji* (Record) is the Middle Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Concealer of Traces and Disperser of Images, named *Kongchang Qijing*, with the style *Bao Dingling*. She wears a vermilion brocade cloak and a blue-embroidered flying skirt.

The seventh star of the *Guan* (Pass) is the Young Maiden of the Dipper’s Center, the Divider of Radiance into Myriad Forms, named *Kongchang Yumo*, with the style *Tian Fanshu*. She wears a cinnabar brocade cloak and a blue-feathered skirt.

The eighth star of the *Di* (Emperor) is the Left Consort of the High Sovereign of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Sun, Moon, Water, and Fire, named *Kongchang Shi Qizhu*, with the style *Luo Maohua*. She wears a purple brocade cloak and an embroidered feathered skirt.

The ninth star of the *Zun* (Honored) is the Right Consort of the High Sovereign of the Dipper’s Center, the Transformer of Metal, Stone, Mountains, and Rivers, named *Kongchang Ai Shangtiao*, with the style *Ling Yu Xuan*. She wears a green brocade cloak and a kingfisher-feathered skirt.

All nine wear their hair in cloud-like topknots.

To ascend the *gang* while holding the breath, one must first call the names of the nine stellar Inner Consorts, then step upon the stars.

The *Tai Bai* (Venus) star lies horizontally, its rays scattering like the edges of a blade. One then exhales the *Three Separates* and *Two Golden Flowers*, causing the *Tu Fei* (Chart Boiling) to fill the *Zeng Yu* (Augmented Realm) and the *Liu Chang* (Flowing Field). The *Xuan Shi* (Mysterious Chamber) is the bright and dense *Tai Bai* star. It moves horizontally, its rays scattering like the edges of a blade, spreading across the nine heavens.

The Perfected One, visualizing this star with its seven rays, constantly exhales the three western rays and draws in the two southern rays. Thus, the golden radiance pierces the eyes, the chart becomes luminous and seething, penetrating the entire body. Once penetrated, one may enter the stellar deities’ *Zeng Yu* and *Liu Yang* palaces. Within these palaces lies the *Xuan Shi*, where one may wander in tranquility and be revered as a Perfected One. These are the names of the chambers within the *Tai Bai* star.

Regarding the practice of the *Tai Shang Yin Shu* (Supreme Perfected’s Concealment Writ), the scripture states: When performing the practice, one should face north while holding the *Yin Shu* (Concealment Writ). This is because beginners in the true and wondrous have not yet ventured into the subtle and distant, do not understand the orientation of stellar positions, nor recognize the Dipper’s directional alignment. Thus, they should face north while holding the writ, gradually seeking understanding. Once the meaning of the writ is grasped and the turning of the stars is recognized with the seasons, one may naturally follow the Dipper’s alignment and pace accordingly. In this way, there is no fixed direction, and one need not always face north. Facing north is merely for beginners.

Perhaps this can be understood by analogy, and no further questions are needed.

The Perfected One of the Supreme practices the pacing of the Five Stars’ Dao to summon the descent of the Five Stars into their chambers. While holding the breath to ascend the *gang*, one must first call the names of the Five Stellar Lords and Royal Consorts, then step over the *gang* and tread upon the stars.

However, worldly affairs often hinder consistent practice, and irregularity diminishes its benefits. In ancient times, the Perfected Lord of Xicheng and the Supreme Immortal of Tongwu both followed this Dao.

chunks.original_text: 谓始上罡便顿住呼名字，呼名字毕，乃越歪蹈星耳。 若每至星上，得复重心呼所至星处之名字，益其佳也。 若其烦重难常，但可按旧而行耳。 昔郁沙公、北里子生、长陵老人，皆按此法而得升天，不以烦难为辞也。 所谓治生者矣。 商贩之汲汲，岂惮崄难哉，所期唯钱货而已耳。 若使求道者常如贾贩之用心，亦有何不得仙耶。 但惜初学者皆言专尽勤至，而后辄懈纵，有似车之将败而百节解落，又似负重之牛造远足蹇。 末学者之所患，而为得者之所笑，皆如此辈事耳。 苟能心研内镜者，是为感发乎神，将有灵人发子之蒙，携辰景之舆矣。 至五星布图，常向南也，以太白位在西，岁星位在东，按而施之。 所以尔者，五星隐伏，纵横无常。 不如北斗列象，常在故一，以定位於五方，不得随星之所在也。 三八景合二十四神，以次念之，亦可一时顿存三八，亦可平旦存上景，日中存中景，夜半存下景，在人意为之也。 若外身幽岩，屏绝人事，内念神阙，摄真朝气，将可平旦顿存三八景，三时又各重存一景，益当佳也。 但人间多事，此烦难常行耳。 事不得常，为益自薄。 昔西城王君、桐梧上真，皆按此道也。 按《苞玄玉箓白简青经》云：不存二十四神，不知三八景名字者，不得为太平民，亦不得为后圣之臣。 受《大洞真经》，应受上道法，衣巾不假人，不同器皿者，车服床寝不共之也。 所以遏秽垢之津路，防其邪风之往来耳。 此甚易行，而以为难，所谓信道不笃，欲飞返沈。 诸修洞房，行步七元者，眠初起、初外时，及临食毕，先微祝曰： 五皇五通，玉字洞房，回元隐道，豁落七晨，生魂者玄父，变一成神，生魄者玄母，化二生身，摄吾筋骨者公子，为吾精气者白元，长生久视，飞仙十天。 毕。 勿令耳闻祝音。 此太上隐祝，以除邪气致精神，欲变化分形，隐沦八方，匿躯藏景，入空造冥，来致万物，讨捕众奸，当修空常之精思也。 当一月七步空常罡，如用步七元日也。 亦以夜半，或以日中，或以平旦，於静室行道。 八节日、六丁日亦修之。 若并重日者，亦再行之，或以步毕#4后仍行，亦善。 此隐沦之要道也。 其空常罡上有二十五黑点： 第一点地名九常，居之逃形。 讳婴育，字通教。 第二点名育常，化身为草木万物。 焕通，字幽元。 第三点名卯常，变身为山陵万物。 金上，字浩停。 第四点名流常，逃气化气。 谷清，字逃迹。 第五点名行常，逃火。 浩兆，字玄升。 第六点名上常，人见之云上天下地。 黄光，字元朗。 第七点名天常，逃火。 寥宨，字卓度。 第八点名玄常。 逃水。 空眺，字霞玄。 第九点名三常，逃兵。 腾旻，字云变。 第十点名辰常，逃死。 内溢，字益微。 第十一点中祝处空常，心也。 当阳，字元元。 第十二点名河常，化作水火。 流精，字七转。 第十三点名元常，住此化作草木。 南治，字精极。 第十四点名古常，住此化作乌随心。 洞生，字微通。 第十五点名巳常，化形为乌兽。 李行，字后化。 第十六点名九常，逃凶。 青包，字上阳。 第十七点名世常，逃神。 苍元，字长明。 第十八点名明常，逃水成地。 碧渊，字洞生。 第十九点名玉常，住此作虎。 归青，字玉阳。 第二十点名法常，化为千身。
chunks.translated_text:
To ascend the *gang*, one should pause immediately upon reaching it and call the names, then step over the *gang* and tread upon the stars. If, upon arriving at each star, one again focuses the mind and calls the name of that star’s position, it is even better. Should this prove too cumbersome for regular practice, one may proceed as before.

In ancient times, Master Yushai, Beili Zisheng, and the Elder of Changling all followed this method to ascend to heaven, undeterred by its complexity. This is akin to the way of managing life. Do merchants, in their eagerness for profit, shrink from peril or hardship? Their sole aim is wealth. If seekers of the Dao were as single-minded as merchants, what could prevent them from attaining immortality?

Yet beginners often claim devotion and diligence, only to grow lax and negligent thereafter—like a cart on the verge of collapse, its joints scattering, or an ox burdened with weight, its hooves faltering on a long journey. Such are the failings of late learners, the very ones whom the accomplished mock.

If one can inwardly refine the mind as a mirror, this will stir the numinous. Then, divine beings may awaken one’s obscurity and bear one aloft in the chariot of celestial radiance.

When arranging the diagram of the Five Stars, one should face south, with Venus positioned in the west and Jupiter in the east, proceeding accordingly. The reason for this is that the Five Stars conceal and reveal themselves unpredictably, shifting without constancy. Unlike the Northern Dipper, which maintains its fixed form and determines the positions of the five directions, one cannot follow the stars’ transient locations.

The Three Eights, combined with the Twenty-Four Spirits, may be recited in sequence. Alternatively, one may invoke all Three Eights at once, or store the Upper Radiance at dawn, the Middle Radiance at noon, and the Lower Radiance at midnight—this is left to the practitioner’s intention.

If one retreats to a secluded cliff, cutting off worldly affairs, and inwardly focuses on the Spirit Gate while gathering the morning’s true qi, then at dawn one may invoke all Three Eights at once, and in each of the three periods, further store one radiance—this would be even better. However, worldly matters often make such consistent practice difficult. Infrequent practice yields only meager benefits.

In ancient times, the Perfected Lord of Xicheng and the Supreme One of Tongwu both followed this Dao.

As the *Baoxuan Yulu Baijian Qingjing* states: "Those who do not store the Twenty-Four Spirits or know the names of the Three Eights cannot be counted among the people of Great Peace, nor can they serve as ministers to the Later Sage. When receiving the *Dadong Zhenjing*, one should also receive the methods of the Supreme Dao. One’s robes and headscarves must not be lent to others, nor should one share vessels, carriages, clothing, beds, or sleeping quarters. This is to block the paths of filth and impurity and guard against the intrusion of perverse winds."

This is easily practiced, yet deemed difficult—such is the way of those whose faith in the Dao is not sincere, who aspire to fly yet sink instead.

For those cultivating the Grotto Chamber and pacing the Seven Origins, upon first rising from sleep, when first venturing out, and after meals, one should softly recite the incantation:

*"Five August Ones, Five Penetrations,
Jade Script of the Grotto Chamber,
Return to the Hidden Dao,
Expand the Seven Dawns.
The Mysterious Father gives birth to the hun-soul,
Transforming the One into spirit.
The Mysterious Mother gives birth to the po-soul,
Transforming the Two into body.
The Duke’s Son gathers my sinews and bones,
White Prime governs my essence and qi.
Long life and enduring vision,
Ascend as an immortal to the Ten Heavens."*

This must be recited without letting the ears hear the sound. This is the Supreme One’s hidden incantation, used to dispel perverse qi and summon spirit, enabling transformation, division of form, concealment in the eight directions, vanishing of the body, hiding of radiance, entering emptiness, and traversing darkness. It allows one to summon the myriad things, hunt down all treacheries, and cultivate the refined contemplation of the Void and Constancy.

One should pace the Void and Constancy *gang* once every seven days, as one would pace the Seven Origins. This may be done at midnight, noon, or dawn, within a quiet chamber. It should also be practiced on the eight solar terms and the six Ding days. If these coincide with doubled days, one may perform it twice, or pace it again after completing the steps—this is also good. This is the essential Dao of concealment and vanishing.

Upon the Void and Constancy *gang* are twenty-five black dots:

1. The first dot is the earthly name *Nine Constancies*, where one may escape form. Its taboo name is *Yingyu*, and its style is *Tongjiao*.
2. The second dot is named *Yuchang*, where one may transform the body into the myriad grasses and trees. Its name is *Huantong*, and its style is *Youyuan*.
3. The third dot is named *Maochang*, where one may transform the body into the myriad mountains and hills. Its name is *Jinshang*, and its style is *Haoting*.
4. The fourth dot is named *Liuchang*, where one may escape qi and transform qi. Its name is *Guqing*, and its style is *Taoji*.
5. The fifth dot is named *Xingchang*, where one may escape fire. Its name is *Haozhao*, and its style is *Xuansheng*.
6. The sixth dot is named *Shangchang*, where people see one as ascending to heaven and descending to earth. Its name is *Huangguang*, and its style is *Yuanlang*.
7. The seventh dot is named *Tianchang*, where one may escape fire. Its name is *Liaotiao*, and its style is *Zhuodu*.
8. The eighth dot is named *Xuanchang*, where one may escape water. Its name is *Kongtiao*, and its style is *Xiaxuan*.
9. The ninth dot is named *Sanchang*, where one may escape weapons. Its name is *Tengmin*, and its style is *Yunbian*.
10. The tenth dot is named *Chenchang*, where one may escape death. Its name is *Neiyi*, and its style is *Yiwei*.
11. The eleventh dot is the central incantation point of the Void and Constancy, the heart. Its name is *Dangyang*, and its style is *Yuanyuan*.
12. The twelfth dot is named *Hechang*, where one may transform into water and fire. Its name is *Liujing*, and its style is *Qizhuan*.
13. The thirteenth dot is named *Yuanchang*, where one may dwell and transform into grasses and trees. Its name is *Nanzhi*, and its style is *Jingji*.
14. The fourteenth dot is named *Guchang*, where one may dwell and transform into birds at will. Its name is *Dongsheng*, and its style is *Weitong*.
15. The fifteenth dot is named *Jichang*, where one may transform the form into birds and beasts. Its name is *Lixing*, and its style is *Houhua*.
16. The sixteenth dot is named *Jiuchang*, where one may escape misfortune. Its name is *Qingbao*, and its style is *Shangyang*.
17. The seventeenth dot is named *Shichang*, where one may escape spirits. Its name is *Cangyuan*, and its style is *Changming*.
18. The eighteenth dot is named *Mingchang*, where one may escape water and become earth. Its name is *Biyuan*, and its style is *Dongsheng*.
19. The nineteenth dot is named *Yuchang*, where one may dwell and become a tiger. Its name is *Guiqing*, and its style is *Yuyang*.
20. The twentieth dot is named *Fachang*, where one may transform into a thousand bodies.

y, there is no fixed direction, and one need not always face north. Facing north is merely for beginners.

Perhaps this can be understood by analogy, and no further questions are needed.

The Perfected One of the Supreme practices the pacing of the Five Stars’ Dao to summon the descent of the Five Stars into their chambers. While holding the breath to ascend the *gang*, one must first call the names of the Five Stellar Lords and Royal Consorts, then step over the *gang* and tread upon the stars.
